title: Placement matchs
body:
I feel like venting a bit so here goes.

I was gold 5 last season with maybe silver 1 MMR, was winning like 16 lp after dropping from G4 (almost got G3 but went 1-2 in promos) after a large lose streak. Anyway I then did my placements, played as best as I could and went 8-2 in the end. Ending up getting Silver 2 which honestly for me just sucks and makes me not want to play. People keep saying the climb is the fun part of league but fuck that, after I get to gold yea its nice to climb but silver is such a slog. Being in Gold I don't feel pressured to play because I know I will get the skin at the end (even though last seasons was barely worth it, Maokais skin sucked but atleast I got Maokai free and hes fun).

Anyone else wish Riot would like ask you if you want to go down divisions at the end of a season? because I don't think going 8-2 should ever make you go down 3 whole divisions. I understand Challenger and Master players getting shoved down but why do you have to do that to Gold and below players that just want to actually climb without having to play this game multiple times every day?

Riot just, this is not a fun way to start a new season it just really isn't. I know people will say its always been like this but that doesn't make it any less fun.

What does everyone else think? what were your placements like?

replies.body: suck it up princess, youre not one of those people who climbed 2 divisions then got dragged back down 2 from that placement game were you.
but that just shows that there placements are stupid, why are you attacking me just because mine wasn't as worse?

> I was gold 5 last season with maybe silver 1 MMR, was winning like 16 lp after dropping from G4 (almost got G3 but went 1-2 in promos) after a large lose streak. Anyway I then did my placements, played as best as I could and went 8-2 in the end. Ending up getting Silver 2..

##We get warned that when we do our placements we will get placed lower than we ended last season. 

I was P4 last season, winning like 19 lp after dropping from p1 (in about a week) after a large losing streak. I got reset into G5. 

> Anyone else wish Riot would like ask you if you want to go down divisions at the end of a season? because I don't think going 8-2 should ever make you go down 3 whole divisions. I understand Challenger and Master players getting shoved down but why do you have to do that to Gold and below players that just want to actually climb without having to play this game multiple times every day?

In order for the reset to actually work **everybody** needs to be shoved down. otherwise you would have challengers in plat and diamond games, and that would also suck.
 It's actually also pretty necessary to give new players a chance to rise to the top, and show off what they have learned. Very often, you see players that get a certain rank (lets say diamond) in one season, then the next they struggle to get out of mid-plat. It isn't because they are boosted, but more because they couldn't adapt to the change. Maybe their 1-trick got nerfed (I had a friend that was chall and is now stuck in high plat because fiora changed and he is still learning another role), or they couldn't adapt to new changes, or even because they got tilted off the fact they deserve better. Likewise, you have players that have remained open to new ideas, kept their champion pool flexible and kept up with at least 2 roles (+support), who seem to shoot up while the rest are still struggling to cope. 

It isn't fun, I agree. I hate gold. It's hard because you have all these people that just got out of silver and think they are the best ever (when in reality they are still potato). They still make stupid mistakes, then blame others and spend the rest of the game typing questions marks into chat while they fall even further behind. 

In the end, I know that I can play well at a mid-high plat level and that I don't want to stay in gold for much longer than I need to. I know that I have ways to challenge myself and have fun while I climb back to where I want to be. I can play a new role, I can flex it up with my friends, I can analyse my stats and track my improvements on the way (I have a weak spot for numbers). 

You just have to suck it up (because if you keep playing, you will be reset again for s8), and learn what makes the climb back up fun for you.

Rito is doing that because they know lots of us have peaked at our tiers and we may start to lose interest in playing ranked if we stay there too long. By bringing all of us down then there will renew interest of climbing. Climbing in Gold or Silver is doable comparing to Bronze where solo queue is unplayable.

TBH they will more than likely do a reset for flex q if they don't can the idea all together, there has been multiple statements made by riot employers saying how flawed the matchmaking and placings are, was watching a vod on iwdominates yet channel and he was versing silvers and bronzes on his challenger account

honestly ill probably just be doing placements for both flex and solo and just playing whichever is the highest or shorter queues. im gonna just take a break from league and come back when Lux ultimate comes out, because fuck these placements.
